title: Female transport workers resort to dangerous coping strategies | ABC NEWS
description: A Rail, Tram and Bus Union survey found that 73% of female transport workers have faced health issues like UTIs due to inadequate toilet facilities. Four in five women reported using dangerous coping strategies, such as dehydration. The RTBU is calling for a national standard requiring dedicated women's toilets. title: Teenage boy dies after stabbing in Sydney's Rouse Hill | ABC NEWS
description: A teenage boy was fatally stabbed in a park near two schools in Rouse Hill, Sydney. The incident took place in a reserve on Caballo Street, behind Ironbark Ridge Public School and Rouse Hill High School.  A crime scene has been set up, and an investigation is underway. title: Female transport workers suffer due to inadequate toilet facilities | ABC NEWS
description: A Rail, Tram and Bus Union survey has found 73% of female transport workers have suffered health issues due to inadequate toilet facilities.  Four in five women said they resorted to dangerous or undignified coping strategies, such as deliberately dehydrating.  The RBTU is calling for a mandatory national standard, including guaranteed access to dedicated women's toilet facilities. title: Israel kills top Hezbollah military official in air strike on Beirut | ABC NEWS
description: An Israeli airstrike in Beirut killed Hezbollah military chief Haytham Tabtabai and four others.  Israeli Prime Minister Benjamin Netanyahu declared his government would take necessary actions to prevent Hezbollah from posing a threat. Hezbollah confirmed Tabtabai's death and stated the attack "crosses a new red line," vowing to continue its fight against Israel and the US. title: Murder trial of man accused of striking student with fire extinguisher begins in Darwin | ABC NEWS
description: The murder trial of a Tiwi Islands man accused of striking a 23-year-old international student over the head with a fire extinguisher while he was asleep in his bed has begun in Darwin.  Brendan Kantilla pleaded not guilty to murder but guilty to manslaughter in the Northern Territory's Supreme Court on Monday morning. By court reporter Olivana Lathouris for ABC News Northern Territory. title: Post Cyclone Fina recovery efforts continue in Darwin with thousands still without power | ABC NEWS
description: 00:00 Thousands of Darwin residents are still without power, as the Top End cleans up after Tropical Cyclone Fina.  As schools reopen and business starts to resume as normal, hardship funding is on offer for those still doing it tough. Matt Garrick has this report.   03:11 While Darwin experienced the outer edge of Cyclone Fina, the eye of the category three system came much closer to Wurrumiyanga on the Tiwi Islands.   In the town, residents recounted in detail just how intense it was. Jack Hislop was there for the story. title: Jair Bolsonaro arrested after taking a soldering iron to his ankle monitor | The World | ABC NEWS
description: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro has once again landed himself in hot water, after he admitted to trying to open his ankle monitor with a soldering iron. In ordering he be taken into custody, Brazil's Supreme Court alleged Bolsonaro was trying to escape house arrest to avoid his 27-year prison sentence for plotting a coup attempt back in 2023. Amanda Robson reports. title: Hundreds of Nigerian school students kidnapped last week still captive | The World | ABC NEWS
description: After one of Nigeria's worst mass kidnappings last week, fifty students have managed to escape their captors and have been reunited with their families. But more than 250 others, including around a dozen staff members, are still being held captive. Ikemesit Effiong is managing partner at SBM Intelligence, a security and risk consultancy firm based in Nigeria. He told The World's Girish Sawlani that economic incentives could be the motive for the latest surge of kidnappings.
